description: Difference between LCM(1,...,x) and first prime >= LCM(1,...,x), where x is a prime power.
comments: The first value corresponds to x = 1, LCM(1) = 1.For the first 100 prime powers, the value is either prime or 1.The values of x are taken to be prime powers so that each distinct LCM occurs exactly once.
example: The 6th distinct prime power is A000961(7)=8, LCM(1,...,8)=840 and 853 is the first prime that follows, thus a(7)=853-840=13.
prog: (PARI) lista(nn) = {for (n=1, nn, if ((n==1) || isprimepower(n), v = lcm(vector(n, x, x)); print1(nextprime(v+1) - v, ", ")););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 09 2015
author: _Labos Elemer_, Nov 14 2000
extensions: Offset set to 1 by _Michel Marcus_, Apr 09 2015
